Comments_List: Communication skills, especially presentation skills.
Necessary communication skill in English culture
Better understanding of conflicting cultures, skills for giving a presentation, logic flow of communication, tactics for negotiation, etc.
Negotiation, email, pitch

Presentation skills
Negotiation skills
Email writing skills
public speaking, presentation, effective writing, vocal image, and basic and advanced communication skills for a professional setting.
Communication, language

A lot of useful skills, from correct pronunciation to effective communication (negotiation), including reading, writing, speaking, and of course listening. The most important thing is, this course provided me with some important communicational principles to use and to think and get progress in daily communication.
Better than expected.
I learned various tips of communication in English
very well
Some topics were interesting, others were very basic.
Global communication class is incredible. The class has polished my speaking, writing in a very professional way and it exceeded my expectations.
Good
Everything has reached my expectation.
We could have focus on some topics more,,, to deepen our understanding

The strengths: very comprehensive and pratical for communication needs (presenting, writing, etc.)
The weakness: the latter part of the class was not very well-organized. The second exam was postponed for nearly a month, and we did not have our chance to go through a review as the syllabus described.
I also suggest that the class should be "encouraged"  but not "obliged" to take for the international students who did not perform well in the August assessment. It takes 3 credits from our original class selection plan and the fact that we the Yale students have to take this class hurts our confidence. I also heard that many SOM students want to be in this class and many FES students prefer not to. In this case, encouragement will be better.

S: talking about negotiation and persuasion techniques
W: some topics were extremely basic. Also, the schedule of the class was very bad. A lot of conferences happen on Thursday at 7 and we could not attend because of this class. Also, a 3-hour class is very dense.

In class discussion with classmates and professor was really great. Assignments also helped the students to practice and see progress. In particular, policy brief paper writing and presentation are incredibly helpful in terms of learning each other among classmates and professor's comments.

Strength: wide topics to give students a comprehensive training.
Weakness: it only lasts for one semester.
Although this is mandatory course for some international students, this course is helpful if you are a first year student and you have never lived in US.
It is a basic class, and every student struggling with the language should take it.
Highly recommend taking this class.
International students should take this class, whether or not you have passed the initial language assessment.
